name: Copenhagen Admiral Hotel

reviews.text: I love historic hotels, and the Copenhagen Admiral does an excellent job of delivering unique charm along with modern amenities. My harbor-view twin deluxe room was spacious, with room for a couch, table and chair in front of a window with a french balcony.
reviews.title: Delightful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was concerned about possible noise on the harbor side due to construction work that was mentioned in some previous reviews, but it didn't bother me. The fact that the work only occurs on weekdays, and two of my three nights were on a weekend, probably helped. The noise that did bother me a little was the outdoor bar underneath my open window (no air conditioning), which remained "festive" well into the night, so I would request a room away from the bar if noise is a concern.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, a bit overpriced

reviews.text: On the other hand, I loved people-watching at the outdoor bar when I was down there, especially the heat lamps and blankets to keep away the chill!
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights on a city trip to Copenhagen. There could be no better location since it is in walking distance to Nyhavn and the pedestrian zone. The rooms were cosy, the bathroom is not modern though. The staff is very professional and friendly. The breakfast is with 20 EUR per person overpriced considering a room rate of 245 EUR.
reviews.title: Great location
Great location and view
reviews.text: I am in the hotel business so when I travel....Im very selective. Stay no where else, the location is perfect, the rooms are modern with large wooden beams from the original old structure. Our room had a loft and faced the canal...wonderful breeze. Staff was helpful and sincere. Technology..Ipad to look up area attractions at desk and free wifi. The food and wine at the outdoor restaurant was great quality and the staff was very nice. A great place to relax after a day of sightseeing. Even some local families stopped bye after a soccer game for dinner. Copenhagen Admiral is the perfect mix of history with modern amenities to enjoy a city city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Admiral is well located - a 5 minute stroll to the main restaurant street - Nyhavn - where the canal tour boats also depart and a further easy 10-15 minute walk to most of Copenhagen's city centre sights and shopping. There are also usually 2-3 taxis waiting outside the hotel and the Reception staff were both pleasant and efficient.
reviews.title: Disappointing Room

reviews.text: However, the room - we booked a Junior Suite - turned out to be a standard (and fairly small) room on the 6th and top floor which had a mezzanine floor added as the bedroom - reached by a cross between a stairs and ladders. The bathroom is the smallest I have seen in a long time - it was possible to touch all four walls with outstretched arms. In addition the carpet was stained although the overall room was kept clean.
reviews.title: Great location, average room

reviews.text: Breakfast is completely buffet style and on busy mornings was not an uplifting experience.
reviews.title: Five star service feeling in a four star environment

reviews.text: Despite its plus points above I would be tempted to go just down the road to the fairly new Nyhavn 71 which is in the same style - a converted old warehouse - but may offer slightly better facilities.
reviews.title: Good location with hotel in traditional old buiding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a great location an everything in central Copenhagen is within waking distance.
reviews.title: Lovely location - great base for exploring

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights at the end of Aug. I read other reviews and agree. The rooms are small and the bathrooms quite small, as well as the hallways, especially when the maid cart was parked there. This isn't your typical hotel, so don't expect it to be. We stayed here because of its history and close proximity to Nyhavn. We were able to easily walk to Nyhavn. Our room was on the 6th floor, and I believe it was a family room, but the staircase in the room was scary with an adventurous 3 year old and it made me nervous, but it was only two nights so I didn't ask to change it. The room was clean. We had drinks one afternoon at Salt, outside, it was quite nice. There is construction going on, but doesn't it seem like there is construction everywhere these days? It didn't take away from the experience. We had breakfast at the buffet. It seemed to offer the standard Danish breakfast. Cold cuts and bread and pastries. Also cold cereal and yogurt, with many toppings to choose from. There was fresh fruit and also some hot offerings, eggs and bacon and small sausages. It was good, and plenty to choose from. The breakfast is not included in the room price. Parking is also not free. Would I return, maybe I would. Oh, when we checked in my son was given an Admiral hat, he thought that was special, he even wore it for a few minutes, hes 3...he doesn't do anything for very long!
reviews.title: Our stay at the Admiral

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Copenhagen Admiral hotel for 3 nights at the end of August. Being our first time in Denmark we had a full on schedule so all we did needed was a room to lay our heads at night.A wonderful woman called Simone Rosa checked us in, expressly introduced everything we need, and she did upgraded the room for us (many thanks).The location is good if you booked a boat trip to the sea. The pick up point just in front of the hotel. You can also rent a bicycle from the front desk to explore the city. Wi-Fi are free and they have a few computer for guests. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice place and great staff

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights, and as contrast, just was in Asia traveling. I've scanned the recent reviews and think they are accurate but maybe some context is helpful.
reviews.title: Not a conventional hotel room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, don't expect large opulent rooms in Europe or Scandinavia, period. Bathrooms are almost always tiny, and the accommodations are always more austere. So with that inind, The Admiral rooms are quite spacious.
reviews.title: really tiny standard rooms are hot noisy and poky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second, this is not a conventional hotel. It is a unique property, utilizing an existing grainary warehosue building, so in order to keep its lovely legacy and character, many compromises are made. If you want to stay in Hilton or Marriott, with a square room with a large view, this NOT the place for you, simple as that. It's charm is the fact of its age age and history. Surely there are air conditioned altnatives elsewhere.
reviews.title: Beware of the summer definitely not 4 star

reviews.text: Sterile reception, unpleasant smell in the room, mini-bar out of service, dust on the furniture, superior room is really not very spacious. Certainly not worthy of 4*.
reviews.title: Poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the location is good and the restaurant is excellent, highly recommended - just don't stay at the hotel.
reviews.title: Not a good experience from a very experienced traveler

reviews.text: We checked in late (10pm). Told we had been upgraded to a suite. The 'suite' was a business meeting room - complete with conference table, white board on the wall and a full compliment of meeting accessories as well as a meeting room sign on the door. In the morning, we took a shower. I came out to discover one towel and the floor mat which I had already placed on the floor. My wife and I shared the one towel. I went to the desk, was told they were sorry. Had breakfast, went back to the room - no towels. Had to dry our hands with toilet tissue when we washed them. Complained to the desk again, told we are sorry. Asked, at that time, about a one hour late checkout. Was told it could be had for 100DK. There was coffee, tea available in the room, but no container to hold the beverage. A 4-5 star expense with a 1-2 star experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spend a weekend with my friends in Copenhagen Admiral Hotel. Great location - we walked from the hotel to almost every sighseeing attraction. The view from our room was very beautifull. Will definitelly recommend it to everybody
reviews.title: Beautiful location but with reservations

reviews.text: The good news is that the hotel is in a wonderful location for views of the harbor and the Amelia Palace. It is a unique structure and the waterfront is wonderful for strolling. Gorgeous views of the Opera House and the Palace. The hotel is well maintained and comfortable. The bad news is that it really isn't an easy walk to the Metro Station at Kongens Nytorv if you have luggage. The streets and sidewalks are all cobblestones which makes a rolling bag a challenge. We also found that many of the recommended restaurants were a cab ride away (cabs are expensive and many won't do short hops). If you can get a deal here, the place is probably reasonably priced but for a waterfront room you have to book through the hotel and they don't discount much. Breakfast buffet was nice but expensive and not included in our room package. Our minibar was stocked but not functioning so nothing was cold and you had to call for room service for any items.We found the staff very helpful and knowledgeable. Overall, if you can get a package deal there, it would be a good place to stay and the views from the waterfront rooms are terrific, and will be even better when they get done building the structure right next door.
reviews.title: One of the best in Copenhagen

reviews.text: I have just returned from a 4 night stay in the Admiral Hotel and found it to be just ok. The hotel certainly appears pleasant from the outside and is reasonably well presented inside but the problems appear as soon as you get to the human factor.
reviews.title: Indifferent service

reviews.text: Location in Nyhavn and surrounding attractions
reviews.title: Not the best experience!

likes.disliked: — The hotel recpetionist (s) always very unhelpful.

reviews.text: Only a few minutes stroll to Stroget etc.
reviews.title: very happy and will stay again
OK but can't join the fan club
reviews.text: Clean
I have stayed at the Admiral several times.... This last time was a fiasco!
reviews.title: Wondering what happened this stay???

reviews.text: My room was NOT clean! I had to call for service. Dirty Qtip on the bathroom floor, coffee cups turned upside down with stains and rings! I am still unsure if my bedding was clean.... The problems were eventually taken care of but I had to request clean cups.
reviews.title: Old and pompous

reviews.text: Breakfast was nice as always.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - but service not 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was visiting hotel on business matters as there was a seminar held nearby in Copenhagen. Large lobby with friendly staff, artful room design full of wooden frames and sepia pictures, very decent breakfast make me recommend the hotel for a stay. The restaurant is pricey and surely you have to go and dine out in the city. As the hotel is located within 10 minutes of Nyhavn you can easily find a great place to eat.
reviews.title: Great location, but not much else to recommend it....

reviews.text: This is a tricky hotel to review. We spent 1 night here in September - a fairly small double room was around £120 for the night.
reviews.title: Best Hotel and Location in Copenhagen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a decent and trouble-free stay at the Admiral Hotel. But the hotel lacks the warm feeling of a boutique or smaller hotel. It feels like a business hotel.
reviews.title: ok time @ the admiral

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotels in Copenhagen are extremely expensive. I chose the Admiral because it was relatively cheaper than other hotels of the same category.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SERVICE
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The reception staff were professional and carried out a smooth check-in. I have mixed feelings about the concierge though. The first encounter was not as positive, as the concierge could have been more helpful. The second encounter (with a different concierge staff) was much more pleasant. You could feel that he was really trying to help you.
reviews.title: Dissappointed

reviews.text: RESTAURANT
reviews.title: Definately Recommend this Hotel

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is so good, on the quay. It is situated not far from the famous places of Copenhagen: Nyhavn, Amalienborg palace, the Little Mermaid, Kongens Nytorv Square. It is opened a beautiful view on the building of "New Opera" from the hotel. Also it is in the vicinity of the metro (underground station Kongens Nytorv - about 8-10 min to go). Our room was on the sixth floor. From our window (not seaside view) we can see Marmorkirken and Amalienborg palace. We liked our room, it had original disain as a ship cabin. We had only one little problem: sometimes there was no warm water. Breakfast was not differented during our staying in hotel (5 days). But it was rather good, traditional for hotels of this class. We like this hotel. But for our next trip in Copenhagen we will prefer smaller and more cosy hotel.
reviews.title: The hotel looks like a ship

likes.liked: — I liked best the location of the hotel
likes.disliked: — I liked least the service on the recepcion

reviews.title: not quite.....
reviews.text: This is really pretty good, but doesn't quite hit the mark. It's an impressive old building, converted into a designery hotel, with a trendy restaurant. The conversion is good quality but lacks imagination. There's a similar place in Hamburg (Gastwerk - see review) which started off with similar raw material but was much more creative in the use of space. The Admiral is just rows of identical rooms, as far as I could tell, with plain and slightly claustrophobic common areas.

reviews.title: No wind in these sails
reviews.text: Also, my room, 577, was tiny. That said the decor and furnishing of the room was fine, bed comfortable, temperature fine.
Check in and check out was swift as well, and the location is perfect.
reviews.title: Keep your wallet handy - you'll need it.

reviews.text: The other minor snag was getting something to eat. I showed up at the restaurant at 7.30 pm to be told there'd be a 45 minute wait, even though the place was 2/3 empty. I reserved a table, then found I could eat at the bar. Returning to cancel the reservation, I was told that a table had miraculously come free. Good job I took the trouble to cancel. A minor point but annoying after a long day travelling.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is opposite construction site which commences work 630AM. In addition, a construction worker is using a megaphone most of the day. Some of the staff are at the best surly others unhelpful. Some are friendly. Do not be deceived by the advertising photographs
reviews.title: Not what the photos depict

reviews.text: This hotel has been built into one of the few remaining warehouses right along the canal front. It is a fab location and very central.
reviews.title: Not the Hotel's Fault ...
Grate place
reviews.text: Unfortunately, there is a MAJOR building project right opposite the front of the hotel which will be going on until 2015. The serious works between now and December 2013 are to do with pile drivers and digging down 12 meters (40 feet) into bedrock. The whole hotel shakes and the noise is frightful. I am a bit disappointed that the hotel 1) didn't warn us and 2) made no effort to apologise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Still, they finish around 4pm and re start around 7am. If noise doesn't bother you and/or you are awake before 7am then it shouldn't bother you. Otherwise, get a different hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel of character

reviews.text: The hotel itself is great, good service, very nice restaurant and pleasant rooms. Shame about the `project' dumped on their doorstep. Would love to return in a few years as I am sure the works will help this hotel in the long run.
reviews.title: Great views of harbor and proximity to city center

reviews.text: Yes, you have to compromise if you want to stay in this nice hotel. The rooms in this 200-year old former grain-drying warehouse are impressively structured by massive wooden beams, beware your head! The small window does not really let much light into the longish room, however, your window to the world, WiFi, is free. Try to get a room at the harbor side since the view on the car park side is not that exciting. There is no air condition in the rooms but you can open the window instead. Then you can not only see but also hear every car passing by. Anyway, the location is great - all point of interest are in walking distance. Furthermore, the service was excellent, and I would stay in this hotel again, but then on the harbor side.
reviews.title: It's special
Great location & very nice hotel
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at this hotel a year ago before an Oceania Cruise. Loved the hotel - easy walking distance to everything. We upgraded to a room overlooking the harbour, which was definitely worth it. After a long day of sight seeing try the bar/lounge outside on the water - wonderful spot to unwind.

Very good place to stay. Unique hotel and it is not very expensive. The hotel restaurant seems to be OK. Rooms are quite small, but the atmosphere is great. The location is good, it is nice to walk around the hotel.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you are greeted by smiling helpful faces, have a charming room with beams and brick, perfectly clean and large (ours was deluxe), a balcony on the water, a good breakfast buffet and fast service........well who would want to be anywhere else?
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Copenhagen

reviews.text: I would prefer the great hotel with the construction rather than some others that were not so good in Copenhagen. Don't like the noise? Request a room on the opposite side.
reviews.title: Great Hotel For Work or Leisure in CPH

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at the Admiral Hotel in late August. Although the hotel is well situated, the service provided from the front desk to room service was less than adequate, and very disappointing. This is clearly a very busy hotel. Perhaps we arrived at the end of the summer season with the result that the staff had customer fatigue, but the attitude of some was inappropriate. We will not stay here again as there are other equally well located hotels in Copenhagen in the same price range.
reviews.title: Good location but very disappointing service

reviews.text: Situated in the very heart of Nyhavn, the unmistakable façade of Admiral hotel has been a Copenhagen landmark for many years. Beautiful reception and fully-equipped room: but small. On locating my room, I found the doors wide open and reception failed to explain why this was the case. AC worked intermittently. Quick service on checking-out. Nice restaurant at the back of hotel. NOTE: There are construction works taking place around this hotel and hence at present gets very noisy in morning and during the day.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, not special

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights, and found the hotel excellent. The position is wonderful, right on the water (although our rooms were at the back, looking at the town - but that's fine too). The rooms were comfortable, lovely beds, plenty of space. We liked the lounge area in the lobby - and although we didn't use the bar other than to order a coffee one evening, the atmosphere seemed relaxed and friendly. The buffet breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in lovely city

reviews.text: Denmark is expensive by UK standards, so this was a pricey hotel for us - but it was worth it.
reviews.title: Noisy but great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Flight got in at 7a.m. And they had a room for me with choice of street or water view. Chose water. Construction of parking structure was a bit noisy and the only negative is I wished they had told me about the construction on check in. I still would have chosen water view. View of opera house, boat traffic, and sailing ships on the quay made the noise inconsequential. Staff extremely helpful I orienting me. Great walking city and hotel only a couple blocks from Nyhavn!
reviews.title: Business or Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed only one night in this interesting hotel, hotel with history. Took a family room on the last 6th floor, two floor room. The room is not big, but very light and clean.
reviews.title: For Copenhagen - an excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has a great location, amazing sea view with old ships.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: Characterful hotel in a great location. Close enough to walk to all the sites of Copenhagen. The rooms were very nice although warm with duvets suitable for winter weather not the summer weather we enjoyed this August. Staff were pleasant and friendly. The buffet breakfast was also very good.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice location and generally a comfortable and clean hotel. You feel a bit short-changed however when you compare what you would get elsewhere for the same sort of price. Very nice bed and linens. Water side views are the best and we had a superior type room, which was a decent size. The bathroom was quite small and a bit tired, again baring in mind the price paid.
reviews.title: Relatively expensive................but this is Copenhagen!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a great location and I would stay there again except not when the weather is hot as there is no air con. and the rooms get very warm...they have a table fan in the room but its not enought.
reviews.title: Great hotel except when hot!
Nice hotel well located
reviews.text: The breackfast is outstanding as long as you get a room rate that has it included...as the cost to buy it is not a good valve.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pretty happy about this hotel. Even if a bit expensive, we enjoyed our stay. The location is great and every attraction was reacheable by foot. The room was big and clean. The cot for our baby was fine two. We had once breakfast and we found it really good
reviews.title: The noise at 7am was most unwelcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wasn’t sure about this hotel given the mixed reviews, however I’m really glad we stayed here. The room was very clean and modern. Location wise, I think it was pretty good with a short walk to restaurants for dinner. Was a little pricey but isn’t everything in Denmark. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Really Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.text: 6 of us stayed at this hotel last weekend. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance from everywhere. The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and very helpful. The rooms were very nice, and the beams in the rooms were a very nice effect! The beds were so comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel for a weekend or mid-week break. The view of the harbour from the back of the hotel was amazing unfortunately we couldn't get a harbour view room as they were booked up! After reading some of the reviews i was a little bit worried about what the hotel was like, but i must say I and my friends were very impressed and will be recommending it to friends!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!
very disappointed!!
reviews.text: I went with Top Customers to the Hotel Admiral, to have a Meeting there. I'm very disappointed about the unfelxibility of the stuff, they are incompetent and rude. It was not possible to order "à la carte" for 10 people and this was explicit requested at the reservation, then we get a Menu that nobody liked it. As well at the Bar, people are very unflexible.For Breakfast it is not possible to get a normal Expresso instead of the tepid american Coffee. Should I go next time to Copenhagen, I would not return at this Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in pretty much the centre of Copenhagen, a 5 minute walk to Nyhavn, probably the most populair street in Copenhagen.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: But the hotel itself is not worth the money. Our room was on the noisy side, which means a street which makes it impossible to sleep after 7:00. We stayed here three nights.
reviews.title: Much better hotels available in Copenhagen

reviews.text: This hotel is a beautiful old grain warehouse with much character. The position is excellent for being in the heart of Copenhagen, I spent several days exploring the city easily on foot from this waterfront hotel.
reviews.title: Annoying niggles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Through no fault of the hotel there can be a great deal of noise.....from 6:30am till 10:00 pm directly opposite the hotel's side of the canal. This work will continue till into 2015. Every morning we woke at 6:30 precisely, to hammering and crane noise.
reviews.title: A perfect location

reviews.text: But, the hotel purports to be four star although there is no air conditioning, swimming pool or spa. Leaving the window open was sometimes essential to cool the room down a bit, but then the building work noise sounds even louder. There is a lovely canal side cafe, but not fully useable and relaxing with the close view of cranes, dump trucks etc. in full action.
reviews.title: Excellent Copenhagen accommodation.

reviews.text: We loved our precruise stay at Copenhagens Admiral hotel, 10 minute drive to port, walking distance from Nyhavn street and more local attractions. They are really nice and keep your bags if you are bording a cruise . Nice comfortable beds, clean, nice bathrooms, and the view from the restaurant is beautiful.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel away from noise but close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 6 nights in Aug 2013. The hotel has a lovely position on the waterfront about 3-4 mins walk from Nyhavn where there are lots of restaurants on the canalside, around 15 mins walk from the Little Mermaid and 2 mins walk from the Royal Palace. It is a large hotel, converted from a granary warehouse. The room was spacious, well decorated, very clean with a sitting area. The bathroom was modern and clean and we had an in-room safe and TV. It was very hot during our stay and there was no air con which we could have done with. There was a fan in the room and we had it on whenever we were in the room including all night. There were 2 restaurants used for breakfast which had an extensive choice of hot and cold food. You could sit outside if you wanted to. There was also an outside bar and eating area on the waterfront where you could eat at night and also a fine dining restaurant. Round the corner from the hotel you can catch the number 66 bus which takes you to the city centre and the railway station which we found very useful both for days out on the train to Roskilde Viking Museum and Helsingor (Hamlet's Castle) and when we had our cases for our onward journey to Stockholm. Surrounding area absolutely fine, hotel is in a quiet position and would have no hesitation about staying here again.
reviews.title: Good hotel in good location

reviews.text: We were travelling with twins, the staff very helpful. we stayed on the 4th floor with view to the town which was quite and nice. although the menu is not at all for kids it was good. near supermarkets and hot spots. love the place!
reviews.title: Great location! Hotel with history and character

description: Experience Danish quality and 200 years’ history when you stay at the Copenhagen Admiral Hotel. The uniquely designed hotel is housed in a converted 18th century warehouse building, located near Copenhagen’s best shopping and cultural attractions, and neighbouring the Royal Palace and the Royal Playhouse.
